heading: Are Waffles gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Waffles and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Waffles can pose a gluten risk primarily due to the use of wheat flour and potential cross-contamination during preparation. Care should be taken to ensure that gluten-free ingredients are used and that proper kitchen practices are followed.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Waffles can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Waffles are gluten free?

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, sauces, marinades, and whether the kitchen has a dedicated gluten-free prep area.
